programme.title: Cold War: Combat Machines and Weapons
programme.desc: We focus on the machines that would have fought in a potential nuclear war. We tell of the 1961 stand-off at Checkpoint Charlie in Berlin when Soviet T-54 tanks faced off with American M-48 Patton tanks. Had that resulted in all out war we may have seen the Russian BMP-1 mechanized infantry vehicle, the smallest tactical nuke fielded by the USA and an experimental flying Jeep.

programme.title: Desert Generals
programme.sub-title: Part Two: Victory & Controversy at El Alemain
programme.desc: At the moment of greatest peril, using unorthodox tactics and on the back foot, the British army fought the Panzerarmee to a standstill and then routed and decimated the German armour. This is the story of the 'forgotten' Battle for Egypt, and the inside picture of the tactics that stopped the German tanks in their tracks.

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Great Tank Battles
programme.desc: This first part of the series introduces the first tanks being deployed on the battlefields in northern France during the First World War and describes the devastating effect these steel monsters had on an infantry confronted with them for the very first time. It tracks the development, both technologically and strategically from the Fuller 1919 philosophy through the German attack on Poland.

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: The Amazing World of War Machines
programme.desc: The idea of tanks began as an extension of armory, with technicians seeing the need for soldiers to traverse the battlefield while being fully protected from enemy fire. As the type of weaponry used in warfare increased in size and caliber, the type of armor required became too heavy and cumbersome, and so the advent of the tank was welcomed by armies worldwide.

programme.title: The Amazing World of War Machines
programme.desc: The idea of tanks began as an extension of armory, with technicians seeing the need for soldiers to traverse the battlefield while being fully protected from enemy fire. As the type of weaponry used in warfare increased in size and caliber, the type of armor required became too heavy and cumbersome, and so the advent of the tank was welcomed by armies worldwide.

programme.title: Thunder Run on Baghdad
programme.desc: The Iraqis wait, divided between hope and fear. Members of the military attempt to save face, knowing that their equipment, which dates at best from the early 1970s, will not weigh heavily against the five hundred armored tanks and seventy thousand men who are equipped with the very latest technology.

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Visions of War: U.S. Marines
programme.desc: On the activities of the 1st and 6th Marine Divisions on the island. A 'Corsair' plane lays a smoke screen to protect tanks crossing a field north of Naha under Japanese artillery fire. Marines follow tanks across open terrain, and mop up Japanese hillside positions after the tanks' flamethrowers have been used. Bazookas are used against Japanese strong points to open a road west of Shuri.

programme.title: WWII: Combat Machines and Weapons
programme.desc: In World War Two machines like the tanks, ships and aircraft received much of the glory. But there was a whole fleet of lesser-known vehicles that made victory in Europe possible. Vehicles like the Jeep, that ensured the frontline troops were kept supplied, and the amphibious DUKW that allowed the Allies to land quickly on beaches and cross rivers en route to Berlin.

programme.title: WWII: Combat Machines and Weapons
programme.desc: For 300 years the Corps of Royal Engineers have been one of the most innovative parts of the British Army. In the First World War we look at the geophone - a device they used to detect enemy tunnellers. In World War II, Royal Engineers operated converted tanks that created bridges and cleared minefields. We examine the mobile robot that defused bombs on foreign battlefields and British streets.

programme.title: 21st Century War Machines
programme.sub-title: Heavy Metal: Tank vs. Anti Tank
programme.desc: The main battle tank in many ways is the icon of 20th century warfare, but in the 21st century how relevant will it be? How effective will it be? And how much will it cost? The modern battle tank differs vastly from where it started and may in fact be reaching the end of its evolutionary process. Will tanks adapt to survive or be forced to retire from battle?

programme.title: Battlefields
programme.desc: April 16, 1917, for the first time in history, French tanks fight their way through the black sludge of Chemin des Dames. One year before, in October, British tanks tried their luck in Somme. In both cases, the long-awaited miracle did not take place. Yet, a century later, the tanks are still here, monsters of technology that are becoming increasingly efficient.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Gulf War
programme.desc: The ultimate test of tank technology is the battlefield. American tanks form the sharp end of the sword in Desert Storm. The U.S. marine corp was still using the older M-60 tank, although with some modifications.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: United Nations Forces Counterattack
programme.desc: Our allied units throw a powerful counterattack against the Reds, Infantry tanks, artillery, and air all combine to throw the Reds back to the North, The Navy blasts the enemy with rockets. Captain Zimmerman interviews Chaplain Joseph Murphy of Boston, Massachusetts, and Captain John Rock, former company commander with the 1st Cavalry Division in Korea.

programme.title: 3 Days in the Life of Lt. Kravtsov
programme.desc: Lt. Kravtsov's mission demands him to quickly assume command and guide his troops through treacherous circumstances. With limited time, he faces the immense challenge of maintaining morale, making tough decisions, and protecting his men in the face of overwhelming odds.

programme.title: 3 Days in the Life of Lt. Kravtsov
programme.desc: This story underscores the harsh realities of war and the profound impact it has on young soldiers like Lt. Kravtsov. It raises questions about sacrifice, the fragility of life, and the emotional toll of warfare. Will Lt. Kravtsov defy the odds and survive his assigned three days? The answer remains uncertain in this poignant narrative of youth and the cost of war.

programme.title: Napoleonic Wars in Russia
programme.desc: In June 1812, Napoleon's 'Grand Army' invaded Russia with over 800,000 soldiers. Despite initial optimism, they faced hardships like hunger and desertion. Alexander I, the Russian Emperor, withdrew from Vilna to engage the enemy. Napoleon hoped for a quick victory, but the Russian strategy was to retreat and draw the invaders deeper into their territory. The French army's discipline waned.

programme.title: Napoleonic Wars in Russia
programme.desc: Napoleon's army advanced toward Moscow in June 1812, eager to defeat Russia's forces and impose peace on their terms. However, the Russians resisted fiercely. The Cossack corps and the Russian vanguard, led by Neverovsky, fought bravely against superior French cavalry. Despite facing overwhelming odds, Neverovsky's men formed a square, defending fiercely, before retreating.

programme.title: Napoleonic Wars in Russia
programme.desc: August 26, 1812. The eve of the bloodiest battle of the Napoleonic Wars in Russia. Two huge armies, quarter million people, clashed near Borodino village, 124 km west of Moscow. Napoleon aimed to seize the village and break through Russian defenses. Bagration's troops bravely fought, but the price was high. Bagration got mortally wounded, but the Russians managed to repel the French attacks.

programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: The Battle of Britain is over. The Luftwaffe has been driven to exhaustion, and Germany suffers its first major defeat. Even though Britain remains undefeated, it is so isolated that Hitler has no concerns about turning his attention East. Operation Barbarossa, the German invasion of the USSR, takes the Soviets completely by surprise and the Red Army suffers terrible casualties.

programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: After the swift success at Smolensk, Hitler has diverted the bulk of Heinz Guderian's panzers down to the South, so as to capture the Ukrainian capital Kiev, considered more important than Moscow in Hitler's mind. It begins a gigantic clash and turns out to be the biggest military encirclement in history.
